alert.note: Alert for McCulloch (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 21 at 5:22PM CDT until June 21 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern McCulloch County in west central Texas... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 522 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over The Intersection Of Us-190 And Ranch Road 1311, or near Calf Creek, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Brady Lake around 545 PM CDT. Brady around 610 PM CDT. Camp San Saba and Voca around 615 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include The Intersection Of Us-190 And Ranch Road 1311. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows.
